Allergan informed the judge that it had just assigned its rights to the patents at issue in the case to the Saint Regis Mohawk Tribe  which  in turn  had granted Allergan an exclusive license to the patents. column4: Breakingviews - Helping Santander helps UK bank competition
column5: LONDON (Reuters Breakingviews) - British taxpayers could end up funding Santander’s efforts to grab a larger share of the UK business banking market. column4: Breakingviews - Goldman necessity mothers M&A invention
column5: LONDON (Reuters Breakingviews) - Goldman Sachs is trying to extricate itself from a box by thinking outside it. The Wall Street firm has set up a small team in what’s known internally as the Innovation Lab  to cook up supposedly clever ideas for big clients. The resulting acquisitions may end up destroying value for the shareholders of the companies involved  but Goldman’s own investors should be pleased the investment bank is trying new things.

column4: Citron's Left says follow-up report on Shopify likely
column5: TORONTO Short-seller Andrew Left of Citron Research said on Wednesday  he was investigating various aspects of software company Shopify Inc's business and would "most likely" publish a follow-up to an Oct. 4 report that sent its shares plunging.

column4: UPDATE 2-Citron's Left says follow-up report on Shopify likely
column5: TORONTO  Oct 11 Short-seller Andrew Left of Citron Research said on Wednesday  he was investigating various aspects of software company Shopify Inc's business and would "most likely" publish a follow-up to an Oct. 4 report that sent its shares plunging.

column5: * Sonic Automotive - about 20% of Sonic's consolidated revenues for first six months of fiscal 2017 were attributable to Houston market locations​

column4: T-Mobile  Sprint deal likely opposed by Justice Dept staff: sources
column5: WASHINGTON When Sprint and T-Mobile bring their expected merger plans to the U.S. Department of Justice for antitrust review  the career staff who do the bulk of the probe into whether the deal will hurt customers will likely recommend that it be stopped  three people familiar with their thinking told Reuters.

column4: T-Mobile  Sprint deal likely opposed by Justice Dept staff -sources
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 11 When Sprint and T-Mobile bring their expected merger plans to the U.S. Department of Justice for antitrust review  the career staff who do the bulk of the probe into whether the deal will hurt customers will likely recommend that it be stopped  three people familiar with their thinking told Reuters.

column4: Fitch says Syngenta risks rating downgrade due to corn lawsuits
column5: CHICAGO  Oct 11 Fitch Ratings on Wednesday became the second major ratings agency to put Syngenta AG on notice for a potential downgrade  over uncertainties surrounding the Swiss-based company's genetically modified corn lawsuit liabilities.

column4: Breakingviews - Syngenta puts Beijing’s unspoken promises to test
column5: WASHINGTON (Reuters Breakingviews) - Chinese officials probably don’t read literary critic Harold Bloom. If they do  they are ignoring his advice to “make what is implicit ... finely explicit.” A dispute over whether the government will stand behind the potential liabilities of Syngenta   a Swiss seed maker acquired by a Chinese state firm earlier this year for about $43 billion  shows the problems that result from habitual murkiness.

column4: Italy ruling party president proposes state role for Telecom Italia network
column5: ROME Italy should play a role in resolving the gridlock over Telecom Italia's (TIM) network assets  possibly by involving state lender Cassa Depositi e Prestiti (CDP)  the president of the ruling PD party said in a position paper.

column4: Italy state lender role in T.Italia could solve network tiff - PD's Orfini
column5: ROME  Oct 11 Italian state lender Cassa Depositi e Prestiti (CDP) could buy part or all of Vivendi's stake in Telecom Italia (TIM) in a bid to protect strategic telecom network assets  president of the ruling PD party said in a position paper.

column4: Brazil court blocks part of Petrobras' $2.2 billion deal with Total
column5: SAO PAULO A Brazilian federal court has blocked part of a $2.2 billion deal signed earlier this year by Petróleo Brasileiro SA and French oil major Total SA.

column4: South Africa's Exxaro completes sale of Tronox shares  nets $474 mln
column5: JOHANNESBURG  Oct 11 South African miner Exxaro Resources said on Wednesday it had completed its sale of 22.4 million shares in U.S. titanium products company Tronox with net proceeds of $474 million. Exxaro  which mainly produces coal  said last week it would sell the shares in Tronox as the company looks to focus on its core mining activities  provide funding for its future capital commitments  repay debt and return capital to shareholders.

column4: Fitch Rates Wal-Mart's $6B Issuance 'AA'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  October 11 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned a 'AA' rating to Wal-Mart Stores  Inc.'s (Walmart) multi-tranche issuance of $6 billion two-year  three-year  five-year  seven-year and thirty-year senior unsecured notes. Proceeds will help fund the cash tender offer of up to $8.5 billion notes maturing 2019 through 2043.
